title: Kirchhoff junction - current between points X Y

content.question: A circuit consists of a battery and four resistors, connected as shown in the figure. The resistors have the indicated resistances. Which of the following claims about the current in the wire section between points <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> is correct, and what evidence or reasoning helps support the claim?

choices.label: There is current in the wire. Points <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> are not the same distance from the battery.
There is current in the wire. There are unequal currents in resistors of unequal resistance.

There is no current in the wire. Points <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> are at the same potential.
There is no current in the wire. The potential difference across all resistors is the same.

content.answer: There is current in the wire. There are unequal currents in resistors of unequal resistance.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
